verses.kjv: Afterward he brought me again unto the door of the house; and, behold, waters issued out from under the threshold of the house eastward: for the forefront of the house stood toward the east, and the waters came down from under from the right side of the house, at the south side of the altar.
verses.web: He brought me back to the door of the house; and behold, waters flowed out from under the threshold of the house eastward, for the front of the house faced toward the east. The waters came down from underneath, from the right side of the house, on the south of the altar.
verses.ct: Then he brought me back to the entrance of the temple, and I saw water flowing out from under the threshold, heading east — since the temple faced east. The water came from under the right side of the temple, south of the altar.

verses.kjv: Then brought he me out of the way of the gate northward, and led me about the way without unto the utter gate by the way that looketh eastward; and, behold, there ran out waters on the right side.
verses.web: Then he brought me out by the way of the gate northward, and led me around by the way outside to the outer gate, by the way of the gate that looks toward the east. Behold, waters ran out on the right side.
verses.ct: He led me out through the north gate and around the outside to the outer gate that faces east. There I could see water trickling out from the right side.

verses.kjv: And when the man that had the line in his hand went forth eastward, he measured a thousand cubits, and he brought me through the waters; the waters were to the ankles.
verses.web: When the man went out eastward with the line in his hand, he measured one thousand cubits, and he caused me to pass through the waters, waters that were to the ankles.
verses.ct: The man walked eastward with his measuring line and measured off 1,000 cubits. Then he led me through the water — it was ankle-deep.

verses.kjv: Again he measured a thousand, and brought me through the waters; the waters were to the knees. Again he measured a thousand, and brought me through; the waters were to the loins.
verses.web: Again he measured one thousand, and caused me to pass through the waters, waters that were to the knees. Again he measured one thousand, and caused me to pass through waters that were to the waist.
verses.ct: He measured another 1,000 cubits and led me through again — the water was up to my knees. He measured another 1,000 cubits and brought me through — the water reached my waist.

verses.kjv: Afterward he measured a thousand; and it was a river that I could not pass over: for the waters were risen, waters to swim in, a river that could not be passed over.
verses.web: Afterward he measured one thousand; and it was a river that I could not pass through; for the waters had risen, waters to swim in, a river that could not be walked through.
verses.ct: He measured one more 1,000 cubits, and now it had become a river I couldn't cross on foot. The water had risen deep enough to swim in — a river no one could wade through.

verses.kjv: And he said unto me, Son of man, hast thou seen this? Then he brought me, and caused me to return to the brink of the river.
verses.web: He said to me, “Son of man, have you seen?” Then he brought me, and caused me to return to the bank of the river.
verses.ct: He asked me, "Son of man, do you see this?" Then he brought me back to the bank of the river.

verses.kjv: Now when I had returned, behold, at the bank of the river were very many trees on the one side and on the other.
verses.web: Now when I had returned, behold, on the bank of the river were very many trees on the one side and on the other.
verses.ct: When I got back, I saw a huge number of trees lining both sides of the riverbank.

verses.kjv: Then said he unto me, These waters issue out toward the east country, and go down into the desert, and go into the sea: which being brought forth into the sea, the waters shall be healed.
verses.web: Then he said to me, “These waters flow out toward the eastern region, and will go down into the Arabah. Then they will go toward the sea; and flow into the sea which will be made to flow out; and the waters will be healed.
verses.ct: He told me, "This water flows east toward the Arabah and empties into the Dead Sea. When it reaches that sea, the stagnant water will be made fresh."

verses.kjv: And it shall come to pass, that every thing that liveth, which moveth, whithersoever the rivers shall come, shall live: and there shall be a very great multitude of fish, because these waters shall come thither: for they shall be healed; and every thing shall live whither the river cometh.
verses.web: It will happen, that every living creature which swarms, in every place where the rivers come, will live. Then there will be a very great multitude of fish; for these waters have come there, and the waters of the sea will be healed, and everything will live wherever the river comes.
verses.ct: "Everywhere this river flows, every living creature that swarms in it will thrive. Fish will fill the water in enormous numbers, because wherever this river goes, it brings healing — and everything it touches will live."

verses.kjv: And it shall come to pass, that the fishers shall stand upon it from Engedi even unto Eneglaim; they shall be a place to spread forth nets; their fish shall be according to their kinds, as the fish of the great sea, exceeding many.
verses.web: It will happen, that fishermen will stand by it. From En Gedi even to En Eglaim will be a place for the spreading of nets. Their fish will be after their kinds, as the fish of the great sea, exceedingly many.
verses.ct: "Fishermen will line its shores from En Gedi all the way to En Eglaim, spreading their nets. The fish will be as varied and plentiful as the fish in the Mediterranean Sea."

verses.kjv: But the miry places thereof and the marishes thereof shall not be healed; they shall be given to salt.
verses.web: But the miry places of it, and its marshes, will not be healed. They will be given up to salt.
verses.ct: "But the swamps and marshes along the shore won't be healed — they'll be left for salt."

verses.kjv: And by the river upon the bank thereof, on this side and on that side, shall grow all trees for meat, whose leaf shall not fade, neither shall the fruit thereof be consumed: it shall bring forth new fruit according to his months, because their waters they issued out of the sanctuary: and the fruit thereof shall be for meat, and the leaf thereof for medicine.
verses.web: By the river on its bank, on this side and on that side, will grow every tree for food, whose leaf won’t wither, neither will its fruit fail. It will produce new fruit every month, because its waters issue out of the sanctuary. Its fruit will be for food, and its leaf for healing.”
verses.ct: "Along both banks of the river, every kind of fruit tree will grow. Their leaves will never wither, and they'll never stop producing fruit. Every month they'll bear a fresh crop, because the water feeding them flows from the sanctuary. Their fruit will be food, and their leaves will be used for healing."

verses.kjv: Thus saith the Lord GOD; This shall be the border, whereby ye shall inherit the land according to the twelve tribes of Israel: Joseph shall have two portions.
verses.web: The Lord LORD says: “This shall be the border, by which you shall divide the land for inheritance according to the twelve tribes of Israel. Joseph shall have two portions.
verses.ct: This is what the Lord GOD says: "Here are the boundaries for dividing the land among the 12 tribes of Israel. Joseph's tribe will receive a double portion."

verses.kjv: And ye shall inherit it, one as well as another: concerning the which I lifted up mine hand to give it unto your fathers: and this land shall fall unto you for inheritance.
verses.web: You shall inherit it, one as well as another; for I swore to give it to your fathers. This land will fall to you for inheritance.
verses.ct: "You will all inherit the land equally, because I swore an oath to give it to your ancestors. This land will be your inheritance."

verses.kjv: And this shall be the border of the land toward the north side, from the great sea, the way of Hethlon, as men go to Zedad;
verses.web: “This shall be the border of the land: “On the north side, from the great sea, by the way of Hethlon, to the entrance of Zedad;
verses.ct: "These are the borders of the land: On the north side, the boundary runs from the Mediterranean Sea along the road to Hethlon, continuing to the entrance of Zedad,

verses.kjv: Hamath, Berothah, Sibraim, which is between the border of Damascus and the border of Hamath; Hazarhatticon, which is by the coast of Hauran.
verses.web: Hamath, Berothah, Sibraim, which is between the border of Damascus and the border of Hamath; Hazer Hatticon, which is by the border of Hauran.
verses.ct: then through Hamath, Berothah, and Sibraim (which sits between the territory of Damascus and the territory of Hamath), and on to Hazer Hatticon, which is on the border of Hauran.

verses.kjv: And the border from the sea shall be Hazarenan, the border of Damascus, and the north northward, and the border of Hamath. And this is the north side.
verses.web: The border from the sea, shall be Hazar Enon at the border of Damascus; and on the north northward is the border of Hamath. This is the north side.
verses.ct: So the northern boundary runs from the sea to Hazar Enon, along the border of Damascus, with the border of Hamath to the north. That is the north side.

verses.kjv: And the east side ye shall measure from Hauran, and from Damascus, and from Gilead, and from the land of Israel by Jordan, from the border unto the east sea. And this is the east side.
verses.web: “The east side, between Hauran and Damascus and Gilead, and the land of Israel, shall be the Jordan; from the north border to the east sea you shall measure. This is the east side.
verses.ct: "On the east side, the boundary runs between Hauran, Damascus, Gilead, and the land of Israel, following the Jordan River from the northern border down to the eastern sea. That is the east side.

verses.kjv: And the south side southward, from Tamar even to the waters of strife in Kadesh, the river to the great sea. And this is the south side southward.
verses.web: “The south side southward shall be from Tamar as far as the waters of Meriboth Kadesh, to the brook, to the great sea. This is the south side southward.
verses.ct: "On the south side, the boundary runs from Tamar to the waters of Meriboth Kadesh, then along the brook to the Mediterranean Sea. That is the south side.

verses.kjv: The west side also shall be the great sea from the border, till a man come over against Hamath. This is the west side.
verses.web: “The west side shall be the great sea, from the south border as far as opposite the entrance of Hamath. This is the west side.
verses.ct: "On the west side, the Mediterranean Sea itself forms the boundary, from the southern border up to a point opposite the entrance of Hamath. That is the west side."

verses.kjv: So shall ye divide this land unto you according to the tribes of Israel.
verses.web: “So you shall divide this land to yourselves according to the tribes of Israel.
verses.ct: "You are to divide this land among yourselves according to the tribes of Israel."

verses.kjv: And it shall come to pass, that ye shall divide it by lot for an inheritance unto you, and to the strangers that sojourn among you, which shall beget children among you: and they shall be unto you as born in the country among the children of Israel; they shall have inheritance with you among the tribes of Israel.
verses.web: It will happen, that you shall divide it by lot for an inheritance to you and to the aliens who live among you, who will father children among you. Then they shall be to you as the native-born among the children of Israel. They shall have inheritance with you among the tribes of Israel.
verses.ct: "Distribute it by lot as an inheritance for yourselves and for the foreigners living among you who have raised children in your land. Treat them as native-born Israelites — they will receive an inheritance alongside you among the tribes of Israel."

verses.kjv: And it shall come to pass, that in what tribe the stranger sojourneth, there shall ye give him his inheritance, saith the Lord GOD.
verses.web: It shall happen, that in whatever tribe the stranger lives, there you shall give him his inheritance,” says the Lord LORD.
verses.ct: "Whatever tribe a foreigner lives among, that is where you must give him his inheritance," declares the Lord GOD.
